intro: Hirculus platysepalus, commonly known as the flat-sepal hircus, is a unique flowering plant characterized by its distinctive flat, broad sepals that resemble small leaves. It belongs to the family Hirculaceae and is native to the arid regions of southern Africa. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color, which help it blend into its environment. Its roots are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. The leaves are succulent and covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss.
